name: pacvar-repeat-expansions
title: Tandem Repeat Expansion Analysis (PacBio)
description: Accurately genotype tandem repeat expansions using PacBio long reads. Critical for diagnosing repeat expansion disorders (Huntington's, FXS, ALS, etc.). Samplesheet format: `sample,bam,bai`
content:
Tandem Repeat Expansion Analysis

Long-read sequencing is the only technology that can accurately measure large tandem repeat expansions responsible for ~50 genetic diseases.

Repeat Expansion Disorders

Neurological:

  • Huntington's Disease: HTT CAG repeats (>36)
  • Fragile X Syndrome: FMR1 CGG repeats (>200)
  • ALS/FTD: C9orf72 GGGGCC repeats (>30)
  • Friedreich's Ataxia: FXN GAA repeats (>66)
  • Myotonic Dystrophy: DMPK CTG repeats

Why Long Reads?

  • Span Repeats: 10-30kb reads cover entire expansions
  • Accurate Sizing: Direct count of repeat units
  • Somatic Variation: Detect tissue-specific expansions
  • Interruptions: Identify repeat interruptions affecting disease
  • No PCR Bias: Long-range PCR-free

Clinical Applications

  • Diagnostic Testing: Identify pathogenic expansions
  • Carrier Screening: Pre-symptomatic testing
  • Prenatal Diagnosis: Risk assessment
  • Disease Progression: Expansion size correlates with severity
  • Genetic Counseling: Precise repeat counts

Pipeline Features

  • PureTarget Panel: 50+ repeat loci
  • Repeat Genotyping: Accurate size estimation
  • Phasing: Haplotype-resolved repeat counts
  • Interruption Detection: Identify stabilizing interruptions
  • Mosaicism: Somatic variation quantification

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with PacBio HiFi BAM files + barcodes/intervals BED files for targeted sequencing.

Key Outputs

  • Repeat Genotypes: Expansion sizes per locus
  • Phased Repeats: Maternal/paternal alleles
  • Interruption Patterns: Stabilizing elements
  • Clinical Report: Pathogenic classifications

Perfect for: Repeat expansion disorders • Clinical diagnostics • Carrier screening • Disease research
